properties.name: The Marquis at Preston
properties.notes: 1990s garden-style apartment community in the Preston area with 1–3 bed units and mid-range rents, offering pool and fitness amenities near Prestonwood and Cary Parkway.

properties.name: Marquis at Cary Parkway
properties.notes: Late-1990s garden-style apartment community near Lake Crabtree with 1–3 bed units, mid-range rents, and resort-style amenities (pool, fitness center, lakes and trails) convenient to RTP and both Cary and Morrisville.

properties.name: Wellsley
properties.notes: Early-1990s custom single-family neighborhood in west Cary with 3–5 bed homes on wooded lots, pool and tennis amenities, and upper mid-to-high prices around the mid-$700k range.

properties.name: Park Village
properties.notes: 1990s single-family neighborhood off Cary Parkway with mostly 3–4 bed homes in the mid price range, close to parks, schools, and major roads.

properties.name: West Park
properties.notes: Mid-1990s single-family neighborhood in west Cary with 3–5 bed homes and upper mid-to-high prices (around low–mid $700k), close to parks, shopping, and top-rated schools.

properties.name: Brookstone
properties.notes: Mid-1990s single-family neighborhood in west Cary with mostly 3–4 bed homes on wooded lots, mid-range prices, and easy access to Cary Parkway and nearby schools.

properties.name: The Enclave at Stone Creek Village
properties.notes: 32-unit luxury 3-story townhome community (3–4 bed, 3–4 bath) built around 2010–2012 in the Stone Creek Village shopping area, with mid-to-upper price point and walkable access to shops at Davis & High House.

properties.name: Upchurch Farms
properties.notes: Early-2000s west Cary neighborhood of midsize 3–4 bed single-family homes with community pool and sidewalks, mid-range prices, and easy access to Davis Drive schools and RTP.

properties.name: Bell Preston Reserve
properties.notes: 2000-era luxury apartment community in the Preston area with 1–3 bed units, mid-range-to-upscale rents, and resort-style amenities (pool, fitness studios, sports courts) near Prestonwood Country Club.

properties.name: Highcroft
properties.notes: Early-2000s luxury single-family neighborhood in west Cary with many 4–5 bed homes, strong schools, and high home values often in the upper $700k to $1M range near RTP and 540.

properties.name: Highcroft Village
properties.notes: Late-2000s luxury single-family neighborhood next to Highcroft with 4–5 bed homes, modern finishes, and high home values around the upper $700k to $900k+ range near top-rated west Cary schools.

properties.name: Westvale
properties.notes: 2013+ west Cary neighborhood of large 4–5 bed single-family homes with upper high-end prices (around mid-$600k with some $1M+ sales), community pool, and quick access to RTP and 540.

properties.name: Copperleaf
properties.notes: Late-2000s luxury neighborhood in west Cary with large custom 5+ bed single-family homes, many valued around $1M–$2M, on wooded lots with trails and easy access to RTP and 540.

properties.name: Greenwood Forest
properties.notes: 1970s–1990s wooded neighborhood just south of downtown Cary with older single-family homes (and some townhomes), mid-range prices, and easy access to schools, Bond Park, and shopping.

properties.name: Farmington Woods of Kildaire Farms
properties.notes: 1970s–1990s single-family neighborhood within Kildaire Farms, with 3–5 bed homes on mature wooded lots, mid-range prices, and convenient access to US-1 and central Cary.

properties.name: Northwoods
properties.notes: 1970s–1990s wooded neighborhood just north of downtown; mix of older single-family homes and some townhomes at mid-range prices.

properties.name: Whittington Park Northwoods
properties.notes: Mid-1990s townhome neighborhood in the Northwoods area (off NW Maynard Rd) with 2–3 bed, ~1500 sq ft units at more affordable prices, walking distance to shops, Bond Park, and greenway.

properties.name: Lochmere Village
properties.notes: Townhome-focused section within Lochmere with 2–3 bed attached homes from the late 1980s–1990s, mid-range prices, and walkable access to Lochmere’s lakes, trails, and nearby shopping along Kildaire Farm Road.

properties.name: Lochmere
properties.notes: Large 1980s–1990s master-planned golf and lake community with mostly 4–5 bed single-family homes (plus some townhomes), luxury-level prices around $800k+, and strong amenities including lakes, trails, and nearby Lochmere Golf Club.

properties.name: Renaissance Manors at Regency
properties.notes: Small enclave of custom brick and stone manor homes (mostly 5+ beds, 5–7 baths) built in the 2000s–2010s, with recent sales around $1.7–1.9M near Koka Booth Amphitheatre in the Regency area.

properties.name: Kensington at Regency
properties.notes: Small luxury enclave in the Regency area with custom 5+ bed single-family homes built in the early 2000s, very high home values around $1M+ and close to Koka Booth Amphitheatre and Regency parks.

properties.name: Lakepoint Village at Kildaire Farms
properties.notes: Mid-1990s townhome community within Kildaire Farms, with mostly 2–3 bed units at mid-range prices, tucked near Lake Pine with easy access to US-1, parks, and greenway trails.

properties.name: Cambridge Woods at Kildaire Farms
properties.notes: Established Kildaire Farms subdivision of 1980s–1990s single-family homes, mostly 3-bed ranch and two-story houses on wooded lots with mid-range prices near US-1 and central Cary.

properties.name: MacGregor Downs
properties.notes: Established 1960s–1990s golf-course community around MacGregor Downs Country Club with large custom 4–6 bed single-family homes, luxury prices often around $1M+, and strong amenities near US-1 and central Cary.

properties.name: Oxxford Hunt Club
properties.notes: Small 1980s townhome enclave (about a dozen units on Union Jack Ln) within Oxxford Hunt; compact 2–3 bed homes with more affordable prices near Bond Park and neighborhood pool.

properties.name: Macarthur Park
properties.notes: 1990s single-family neighborhood near Cary Parkway and Lake Pine with mostly 3–5 bed homes, upper mid-to-high prices, and convenient access to parks, shopping, and US-1.

properties.name: Carpenter Village
properties.notes: Early-2000s “village-style” neighborhood with a mix of single-family homes, townhomes, and nearby apartments, walkable streets and ponds, and high home values in west Cary near Davis Drive and RTP.

properties.name: Cameron Pond
properties.notes: 2005–2010s luxury single-family neighborhood in west Cary with large 4–5 bed homes, lake and pool amenities, and high home values often around the upper $700k to $1M+ range near RTP and 540.

properties.name: Cary Park
properties.notes: Large master-planned community in west Cary with a mix of single-family homes, townhomes, and condos, 2000s-era construction, and high but varied home values around a central lake and parks near RTP and 540.

properties.name: Sedgefield
properties.notes: West Cary luxury new-home community (built 2014+), with large custom 4–5 bed single-family houses around or above $1M and easy access to RTP and 540.

properties.name: The Oaks at Highcroft
properties.notes: 2010s west Cary neighborhood of large 3–5 bed single-family homes with modern finishes and strong schools, at an upper mid-to-high price point near RTP and 540.

properties.name: Courtyards of Preston
properties.notes: Small mid-1990s patio-home section of Preston with mostly 3-bed single-family homes, HOA-maintained exteriors, and mid-range prices near Prestonwood Country Club and Cary Parkway.

properties.name: Georgetowne
properties.notes: Late-1990s single-family neighborhood near Cary Parkway with mostly 3-bed homes, mid-range prices, and quick access to shopping, schools, and central Cary.

properties.name: Huntington Woods
properties.notes: Early-2000s neighborhood of midsize 3–4 bed single-family homes with mid-range prices, tucked between Cary and Morrisville with convenient access to RTP and Davis Drive schools.

properties.name: Preston Vistas
properties.notes: Small cul-de-sac enclave of large 1997–2012 single-family homes in the Preston area, with 4–5 bed houses often valued around or above $1M.

properties.name: Stonewater
properties.notes: 2007–2014 master-planned community in west Cary with midsize 3–5 bed homes, community pool and clubhouse, and competitive mid-to-upper price point near RTP and 540.

properties.name: Amberly
properties.notes: Newer planned community with large homes and strong HOA amenities.

properties.name: Preston
properties.notes: Large golf-course community around Prestonwood Country Club with 1990s+ custom single-family homes and townhomes; very high home values and strong amenities.

properties.name: Cortland Highcroft
properties.notes: Newer luxury apartment community near the Highcroft area with 1–3 bed units, modern interiors, mid-range-to-upscale rents, and amenities like pool and fitness center close to west Cary schools and RTP.Newer luxury apartment community near the Highcroft area with 1–3 bed units, modern interiors, mid-range-to-upscale rents, and amenities like pool and fitness center close to west Cary schools and RTP.
